title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Oxnam and Teviot wereboth in spate, and their moan could be heard when the wind rested for alittle and allowed the fir trees to be still.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Oxnam and Teviot wereboth in spate, and their moan could be heard when the wind rested for alittle and allowed the fir trees to be still.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Two miles east of Bonjedward is Crailing, the ancient seat of the Cranstouns, the border family that figures in the Lay of the Last .Minstrel, situated on the retired and romantic stream of Oxnam, which here falls into the Teviot.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Oxnam, a river of Scotland, in Roxburghshire, which rises in the parish ofOxnam, and after a course of 12 miles,through steep and romantic banks, fallsinto the Teviot.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Oxnam, anciently Oxf.nham, a parishof Scotland, in Roxburghshire, 9 miles long,by 5 broad.

title: Murmurings from rugged waters.
author: Broomfield, James Polwarth. [from old catalog]
snippet: He must hae swam the Oxnam."
